TopicTitle: Advanced Aircraft, Building Techniques And Help

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, V8jester said:
> 
> 
> Well, What are your system specs and are you on Windows 10? Win 10 will actually not run KSP in DX9 properly unless you add the ( -dx9) flag in the shortcut target field. And on that note. Are you running OpenGL or DX11?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Personally I find DX9 plays the best with Scatterer and EVE, yielding the best performance. You need the memory to run it this way. But it tends to smooth everything out. 16GB is really the best amount of ram to run this game with, when heavily modded.
> 

Windows 7

GeForce GTX 970

Intel i5-4430 CPU @ 3.00Ghz (quite low I know)

8Gb Ram

Currently I'm using the -dx9 method along with -popupwindow.

My original 64bit KSP folder following your guide reached near 100+ mods after I found myself on a mod downloading spree to try KSP 64bit. Surprisingly it ran! Albeit with a zoom glitch that prevented me from zooming with mouse scroll.

Here's the thing I'm trying to get rid of :

![iSgrTvM.png](http://i.imgur.com/iSgrTvM.png)

Above the horizon the black line and the subtle line in the middle.

An i5 is nothing to shake a stick at. And you have the same video card I do. 8gb of ram isn't the best but it is enough to run the game. That zoom glitch, have you tried fast switching out and then back into the game? I get that all the time with -popupwindow. Alt-tabbing should take care of it.

The horizon line is due to a change of how Blackrack renders the ocean. He is working on it but for now we just need to deal with it. I've also been getting that faint line across the middle of the screen since the new ocean shaders. I personally just deal with it as I love the new oceans. I think a lot will change after 1.1 hits. And blackrack / Rbray have a chance to rework everything. For now have you tried DX11? I don't run it personally, but I know a lot of people have been getting good results to decrease there memory footprint.

Strange... I have -dx9 and -popupwindow on my install and they work fine. Do you have **[GC Monitor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83821-10x-gcmonitor-127-a-graphic-memory-monitor-july-8th/)** installed? I'm curious just how much ram you're soaking up. With DX9 enabled on my install I can chew through 11-13GB of Ram. So DX9 my be your problem.

edit

Duh it's in your screenshots from earlier ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") You are using close to 7GB on an 8GB system. It's just cutting it too close. I'm within 3 GB wich leaves a little more of a margin for the system to use. If you chew up all your ram in the game there is just not enough to run everything else. Might want to think about an upgrade or consider trimming down your mods / textures. AVP is also kind of a memory Hog to begin with unfortunately.

Well actually, I tested an install just with BD Armory and with -dx9 and -popupwindow. It gave the same result every time I launched a stock craft. As you can see in the screenshot above, I hit 5gb of ram for this particular install that only has all the visual and sound mods with BD Armory. I have another install which runs at 6gb + on launch and 8gb after some time in game, but it didn't crash instantly or cause glitches,  just overtime going in and out of the SPH crashing in the loading screen problem that also persist in 32bit KSP.

I might look and test more in this, hopefull I can find a solution of sorts. But thanks for the info! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Also, is there a manual somewhere that shows what each of the EVE cloud settings do? I'm trying to get thicker clouds with another layer of low altitude clouds, as well as increasing the distance of which the clouds appear, I hate to look at a flat layer texture of clouds everytime I fly, it sucks the immersion out.

Yup that sounds about right for an Osprey. The FS rotor has a bug where the max rpm is not persistant. You need to tweak it in flight every time. You can try bugging Roverdude and Snjo on th FS thread about that one.

The hover button on the rotors really doesn't work very well. Try [Vertical Velocity Control](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50736-1-0-2-%28Apr30-15%29-Automate-Vertical-Velocity-and-Altitude-Control)

And lastly to keep the Osprey from bouncing during a hover. Use [Quantum Struts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93818-1-0-QuantumStrutsContinued-1-3-Magical-Struts-for-Rigidifying-Outside-the-VAB) from the fuselage to the engine nacels. You can then lock the nacels in VTOL or forward flight.

I ignore the "Low TWR" Warning. as long as it's working then it really doesn't matter. That rotor I sent you also has a crazy amount of SAS force applied to it. so if you need more or less SAS assistance. just tweak the steering factor in the GUI menu.

I did watch your video. Looks like you have a lot of potential for YouTubing, nice job. A couple suggestions though. Try never to use the keyboard to move the camera angles around, **[KerbCam](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/22781-0235-kerbcam-v013-camera-pathing-tool-for-videos/)** is outdated but still works great. It looked like you used CameraTools quite a bit, so good job there. Make sure you are always hiding the mouse curser on the right side of the screen. And make sure you aren't filming while in windowed mode.

Would it be possible for you so share some of youre craft files? Im particularly interested in the two refueling tankers you have in your other topic, along with the F-22, B-1B and the AC-130. I saw on one of your youtube vids that you dont really share them anymore, because of support issues but Im more than happy to figure out what mods I need myself.
